titlestmt.titleproper: Pennsylvania Museum of Art 69th Street Branch records 1928-1933
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Pennsylvania Museum of Art 69th Street Branch records

bioghist.p: In 1931 the 69th Street Branch Museum of the Philadelphia Museum of Art was established, and Philip N. Youtz was hired as Curator. Funded in part by a Carnegie Corporation grant to support modern art, the Branch displayed temporary exhibitions of contemporary and recent artists from the permanent collection. The Branch was an experiment in branch museums, and financial belt-tightening of the Depression forced its closing in 1933.

scopecontent.p: This collection documents the establishment, operation, and the closure of the 69th Street Branch Museum of the Philadelphia Museum of Art. The records date from 1928 to 1933 and include correspondence, minutes, exhibit files, publicity materials, and photographs. The correspondence includes letters between Youtz and PMA curators and staff, curators at other institutions, and professional associations. There are also copies of Fiske Kimball letters that relate to the operation of the Branch. Minutes of the Committee on Museum, 1931-1932, document the process of establishing the Branch. Exhibit files offer a more detailed look at the selection of works displayed at the Branch. These files include budgets, lists of artworks displayed, loan and insurance records, sketches of exhibit layouts, correspondence with curators and lenders, exhibition schedules, attendance statistics, posters for exhibitions and lectures, and abstracts of lectures and panels. Publicity materials include press releases on the Branch and its programs and exhibits, brochures and announcements, newspaper clippings. There are several black and white photographs of the Branch's galleries and of artworks being considered for exhibit. The collection also includes manuscripts of articles by Youtz , including an article on the 69th Street Branch, given at a meeting of the American Association of Museums in 1932.

controlaccess.corpname: Pennsylvania Museum of Art. 69th Street Branch.

Art museums--Educational aspects.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An online finding aid is available at http://www.philamuseum.org/pma_archives/search.php?c=SIX.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Philadelphia Museum of Art: Fiske Kimball records.
